bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Orange County was formed from Spotsylvania County in 1734.
An act passed by the Virginia legislature in 1803 required every free negro or mulatto to be registered and numbered in a book to be kept by the city clerk.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Orange County (Va.) List of Free Negroes, 1810-1850 circa, lists the age, name, color, stature, marks or scars, in what court the person was emancipated or whether the person was born free. Some clerks recorded additional information not required by the law. The register is indexed.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Orange County Free Negro and Slave Records can be found in the Local Government Records Collection and on microfilm at The Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm".
